intro: Rhexia muricata, commonly known as the roughleaf bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are leathery and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Rhexia muricata thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
